title: Global neon/glow animated background + working sidebar close (X) with slide-out animation

requirements.text: Apply a global animated neon/glow background effect across the entire website (all routes), not just within specific panels, while keeping all UI content interactive (no blocking pointer events) and ensuring legible contrast for text/icons.

quotes: add neon/glow animated to hole website

acceptanceCriteria: All pages (e.g., /, /products, /news, /terms, /admin) display an animated neon/glow background behind the main content.
The animated background layers do not intercept clicks/scroll/inputs (e.g., links/buttons remain clickable; scrolling works normally).
Background animation respects `prefers-reduced-motion` by disabling or significantly reducing motion while retaining the neon color scheme (no rapid movement when reduced motion is enabled).

requirements.text: Add a visible, functional close (X) button to the sidebar drawer UI so users can close it reliably; clicking the X must close the sidebar and trigger a slide-out close animation in the same direction the sidebar opens (e.g., left sidebar slides out left; right sidebar slides out right).

quotes: 3. also trigger any animation when closing

acceptanceCriteria: When the sidebar drawer is open, an X close button is visible within the sidebar UI and is keyboard accessible.
Clicking/tapping the X closes the sidebar and a slide-out animation plays (no instant disappearance).
The sidebar slides out in the same direction as its opening side (left drawers slide out left; right drawers slide out right).
No console errors occur when opening/closing the sidebar repeatedly.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only shadcn components); compose/wrap them instead.
Do not modify immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`).
Frontend-only change; do not introduce new backend canisters or external services.
nonGoals: Adding new pages or store features unrelated to the neon background and sidebar close behavior.
Changing authentication flows (Internet Identity / customer/admin sessions).
Backend schema/state migrations (not required for this UI-only change).
